inn1.comm: Roach is full to start, new opener Mawoyo turns the ball to leg.
And again, Roach targets the stumps and Mawoyo is forward, turning his hands over the ball to nudge to midwicket.
starting outside off, and tailing in through the air and further off the pitch. Mawoyo's defense holds firm.
A slightly bottom-handed drive rolls to cover.
Roach continues to attack the stumps with full, fast bowling - though not quite his quickest. Mawoyo drives on the walk to cover.
a maiden to start, Mawoyo tapping watchfully to mid-on.
Shaping away, left well alone.
First runs of the innings, chopped down to third man.
beaten outside off! Or did Mawoyo play inside the line? Well, either way ball has passed bat.
Full and on target. Mawoyo presses forward in defense. Both West Indian opening bowlers have been on target so far.
and, just as I write that, Best slips one towards Mawoyo's pads and is worked away for a couple.
phew! That is quite some delivery to end with. Landing full outside off, it took off and hooped away. Half left by Masakadza, though I'm not sure how he'd have got any bat on that one.
Sibanda is rock-solid in defense as Roach hits a perfect line and length.
and again. Zimbabwe's openers have been quite reticent, and Roach is yet to concede a run.
now Sibanda drives, aiming square on the off side, but the ball comes off the inside edge and rolls through square leg instead.
firmly driven, but straight to Kieron Pollard at short extra cover.
A little shorter, and rising off a length. Nudged to point.
Roach hasn't been at his quickest today, but his final delivery is quick enough to beat Sibanda's pull and strike a stinging blow to his thigh.

what's happened here? A brutal delivery from Best, the effort ball, spits off a length and causes Mawoyo all sorts of trouble. He fends wildly, the ball looping off the glove but landing safely in front of the slips.
Nudged off the hip to fine leg.
Mawoyo gets up on his tip-toes to ride the bounce and punch to cover point. Not much timing in the shot.

Best is giving Mawoyo a thorough working-over here! He flings down another thunderbolt which catches Mawoyo at the crease, hitting his chest and ballooning to Ramdin. Mawoyo did well to drop the hands on that one ...
much fuller this time, Mawoyo getting across to flick to fine leg.
and short it is, but the pull is a controlled one, Sibanda rolling the wrists on it to pick up a single.
Sibanda stays deep in his crease and angles the bat to pick up a single to third man.
on a length and straight, turned to midwicket.
Mawoyo walks into a drive, the ball rolling to mid-off.
Guides down to third man.
Sibanda finds a run on the leg side, picking the gap at midwicket.
but Mawoyo can't pick the same gap, and it's a dot ball to finish.
booming drive! But Sibanda hits nothing but fresh air, beaten by some away movement outside off.
Sibanda rides the bounce to glide the ball off the face of the bat to third man.
a firm square drive is intercepted by Powell at backward point ... Saving three runs.
short and rising outside off. Sibanda punches a drive off the back foot, but picks out a fielder.
shot! Again Best lands the ball close to the bat, inviting the drive. Sibanda is equal to the task, driving through extra cover, but the ball is stopped by Sarwan before it reaches the rope.
nudged softly to point to end the over.
on a length outside off, still wonderfully accurate stuff from Roach.
fuller, straighter, and driven to mid-on.
Sibanda taps defensively towards cover, but there's no room for a cheeky single.
fuller still. Sibanda is a little squared up, and skews a drive to point.
whipped powerfully to midwicket, where Dwayne Bravo gets in the way of the ball ... but it bounces awkwardly in front of him and he's struck amidships! Ouch ...
stolid defense ends another quiet over.
a fierce lifter strikes Mawoyo on the shoulder and flies down to third man.
Sibanda helicopters into a wild cut, but can't lay bat on ball. He was looking to thrash it over point, but was beaten by pace and bounce.
glanced off the pad for a welcome single. Neither batsman really wants to be on strike to this sort of bowling ...
ah, the slower one from Best! Mawoyo appears to pick it, tapping to mid-off and setting off for a run.
Sibanda looks for a tip-and-run single to extra cover, but he's swiftly sent back.

aggression! Sibanda spots another slower one from Best, this one delivered at around 118kph, and lofts it to the vacant long on region. The ball plugs in the outfield, but they're back for the second.
short outside off, and cut through cover point, two runs the result.
angled down to third man, this one pitching much wider of off.
hopping defense from Sibanda.
curving in from outside off, Sibanda defends with bat and pad together.
pitched right up to the bat, Sibanda drives to mid-off.
full once again, punched firmly back to the bowler, who fields in his follow through.

and he's done it again! Mawoyo appeared uncertain as to which way the ball would spin, and thrust his bat and pad out together. The ball pitched, spun in and struck the pad. There's a huge appeal, which Ian Gould denies ... but Narine insists on a review. And this is out! It looked borderline on first viewing, but it's struck him in line and would have taken out leg stump.
Masakadza nudges watchfully to fine leg to begin his innings. There is a man at slip, and another at short leg ...
this time he's down the wicket, but Narine spots him coming and stops him with a quicker one.
punched to extra cover off the back foot.
tapped back down the track.
obdurate defense ends the over.
seaming in off the track, Sibanda defends from the crease.
driven straight down the ground, but Roach is at long on and keeps them to a single.
Masakadza's bottom hand comes into play as he flicks to midwicket.
finally, a boundary! Masakadza breaks the drought with a slightly uncultured heave into the leg side. It wasn't the prettiest shot, but it had power behind it and it got the desired result.
and he follows that with a single to long on, Bravo continuing to keep the ball up to the bat.
Sibanda defends, on the walk, to end the over.
whipped to midwicket.
Masakadza leaves his crease to get to the pitch, and forces the ball down the ground for a single.
appreciable spin off the track for Narine, and it's enough to beat Sibanda's attempted nudge to leg.
floated up much fuller outside off, Sibanda stretches forward to defend to point.
Narine giving them nothing to hit, as Sibanda gently pings the leg side field.
and another flick to leg is missed, the ball striking the batsman on the thigh.
pitched right up to Masakadza, who presses forward defensively.
there's a drive from the batsman, but it's stopped by the bowler in his follow through. Bravo is bowling a superb wicket-to-wicket line.

bowled him! Masakadza has been tied down by some accurate bowling, and the frustration showed as he backed away to leg and tried to open up the off side. But Bravo's line was impeccable, and he wobbled the ball past the bat to disturb the stumps. The bowler is ecstatic, and celebrates Gangnam style ...
Taylor leans forward and plays across his front pad, as is his wont. No run.
watchful defense from Zimbabwe's captain, playing with a nice straight bat.
Bravo sends his final delivery of the over a little wider of off stump, and Taylor shoulders arms.
spinning in off the track, turned to leg.
quicker through the air, but the offspinner again and Sibanda turns it to midwicket, playing with the turn.
rising off a length to strike Sibanda on the thigh.
a hint of width is offered outside off, Sibanda cutting straight to backward point.
speared down the leg side, a clear wide.
nudged softly to point, Sibanda playing back and across
a boundary for Sibanda! Narine had kept his length on the short side to deny the drive, but this was too short and Sibanda rocked back to pull firmly to deep midwicket.
lofted confidently over the leg side field! When Bravo is accurate, he can be very hard to get away, but when he strays he does so at a very hittable pace. A leg stump delivery is dispatched.
that's better from West Indies' captain, hitting a length on off stump. Taylor defends.
wicket to wicket once again, and the batsman can only defend.
Taylor is looking to be positive here. He shuffles right across to the off side to fetch a delivery down to fine leg.
good, early call from Taylor. Sibanda just tapped the ball softly to point, and he was called through straight away.
driven to long on to end the over.
Taylor finds a single to short fine leg via the inside edge. He didn't appear to read this one.
an off stump half volley is fetched into the leg side, but a diving midwicket fielder saves the run.
shot! Again Sibanda seizes on one that is too short and too wide, this time thrashing a cut through cover point.
swept. There are shouts of "catch it!", but the ball rolls into the deep quite safely.
flicked across the line to midwicket.
and a diving midwicket fielder is once again in action to deny Zimbabwe a run, Taylor playing with the spin.
driven powerfully through extra cover! Sibanda is surely stepping up now, getting right to the pitch and driving the ball in the air but through the gap and away to the boundary.
there's an appeal for a catch behind the wicket, the ball rising down the leg side ... but that's brushed the pad and nothing else.
Sibanda is flowing now! He picks up a length delivery and heaves it high into the leg side. Darren Bravo was out at midwicket, but it was hit well enough to beat the fielder.
outside off this time, and left alone.

Best at short fine leg saves three runs, and very nearly effects a run out! Sibanda tipped a full toss in his direction, but he got low to stop the ball and was back up in a flash as Taylor charged through. A better throw would've had him ...
Taylor defends to midwicket to end the over.
a little short to start, and Sibanda punches out to the cover sweeper.
attempted reverse sweep from Taylor! He doesn't think he needs a sighter ... but the shot doesn't come off, so perhaps he should have.
nudged to point in far more orthodox fashion.
defended to off once again.
a chip shot bounces down to long off. A controlled stroke, Taylor checking the shot.
turn for Permaul! This one gripped and spun sharply, squaring Sibanda up from round the wicket. But the ball rolls into space at cover, and they take a single.
he's full to start, and Sibanda whips across his pad to find two runs to square leg.
sharp bouncer! That'll keep the batsman deep in his crease. Sibanda ducks as the ball approaches him, dropping his hands.
much fuller this time. Sibanda digs it out back down the track, and Best threatens to throw down the stumps after picking the ball up in his follow through ...
short again, and this time Sibanda rocks back to pull! He gets a good connection on the shot, but there's a man out at deep square to cut it off.
dug in once more, but this one goes down the leg side and is called wide.
Full, pushed back to the bowler.
and yet another full delivery to end the over, Taylor pushing it to backward point.
chopped down to third man, and he's into the 40s.
this time he's nailed the reverse sweep! Taylor bends low, reverses his hands, and sends the ball skittering past Russell at backward point.
slashed down past Russell once more, this time Taylor on the cut, and they're back for the second.
beaten on the cut this time! Permaul loops it down from round the wicket as Taylor steps back, but his shot is beaten by turn and bounce.
not this time! Taylor skips out to get to the pitch, and scythes a drive through extra cover. This has they makings of a confident partnership, and it's nearing fifty.
turned into the leg side for single to end the over.
shot! Taylor seizes on a short, wide delivery and uppercuts it over third man, where Narine is placed, having come back onto the field. But it's well hit, and flies over him.
that's better from Best, keeping Taylor rooted to the crease with line and length.
and again. Taylor looks to work the ball into a gap on the leg side, but can't find the gap.
glanced to fine leg for a single.
Sibanda stands tall to ride the bounce and look for a single to third man, but there's none to be had.

Best strikes! This didn't look like the most lethal delivery, just full and aimed at the top of middle. There was, perhaps, a touch of away shape on it, and Sibanda just closed the face of the bat too early. A leading edged skewed in the air towards mid-off, where Deonarine took a simple catch.
a confident start from Taylor! He sweeps straight away, not bothering to keep the ball down, and it sails over long leg.
turned to midwicket.
flicked with the spin through square leg.
Chakabva is off the mark straight away, easing the ball down to long on.
and Taylor follows suit, driving with no great flourish down the ground.
Chakabva threads the gap at square leg for another single. These two have rotated the strike really well in this over, and there's not been much turn for Deonarine.
,Chakabva comes forward, then rocks back to punch, but can't beat extra cover.
looped up outside off once again, and the batsman can't get it away.
Chakabva looks very busy at the crease as he clears the left leg and thrashes this out to deep cover for a single. An aggressive stroke for just one run.
Taylor sets himself to sweep but then changes his mind, defending to the off side.
too straight from Permaul, and Taylor picks a single to leg as the ball rushes on with the arm.
drilled hard down to long off. Chakabva has settled quickly.
Deonarine comes round the wicket to Chakabva, spearing the ball down flat and fast. Tapped back to the bowler.
chipped up and over the infield, but dropping short of long on. It looked an intentional stroke.
a misfield from Roach at midwicket allows a single, and brings up Zimbabwe's hundred.
Chakabva stays back in his crease to send the ball rolling out to square leg.
flicked to Roach once again, this time he stops it cleanly.
Taylor skips out to take the ball on the full, sending it out to deep midwicket.
swept from a middle stump line, but it's a good connection and brings a brace.

skewed to extra cover, and Powell holds a simple catch to get rid of Taylor! He'd been trying to take the attack to the spinners in this innings, and had cruised along at better than a run a ball, but now he's paid the price for one shot too many. He tried to drive over extra cover, but wasn't close to the pitch and lost control of the stroke as the ball spun and bounced away from him.
solid defense from Chakabva.
yet more defense, Permaul firing the ball at middle stump.
nicely accurate from the left-arm spinner, and Chakabva is happy to defend.
a touch too straight to end the over, and Chakabva flicks to short fine leg.
punched down the ground for a single.
slashed hard to cover point, but straight at the fielder.
Waller is on the front foot now, and sends the ball in the same direction to cover point, covering the spin well.

this time he's found the gap! West Indies have brought a number of fielders into attacking positions, but that means the wide long off boundary is unprotected, and Waller finds it with a spanking drive. Well hit.
no run this time, as Narine gives Waller no width to work with.
short leg is interested in the catch as the ball bobbles off the inside edge, but the ball drops well short of him.
Chakabva uses his feet, skipping out to drive a single to long on.
punched firmly to cover.

heaved high, but not all that far! Waller was aiming for a six over long on, but he got underneath it a little too much ... Fortunately for him, the the ball landed safely, and they're back for a second.
pushed back to the bowler.
just a hint of width outside off, and Waller uses it to find a single to third man.
Chakabva whips across the ball to find a single to long on.
flung too far down the leg side, and they take a run as Ramdin fumbles the take.
that's on target, and Waller offers a front foot defense.
beaten outside off! Waller fancied the cut, but the ball was quicker and bounced on him to beat the edge.
this is really slippery bowling from Narine, who zips this one in off the track to strike Waller on the pad ... There's an appeal, but he's hit outside the line of off.
turned past short fine leg for a single.
not picked, not even close! Chakabva closed the face of the bat on this one even as it left him off the pitch, and he's very fortunate as a thick edge flies past a diving Powell.
Turned rather more calmly into the leg side for a single.
flighted enticingly, but driven straight back to the bowler.
another drive, this one intercepted at cover.
a stifled appeal for low, as Waller misses the sweep and is struck on the pad. It was, I think, going down leg with the arm.
that'll relieve some pressure! Permaul errs outside off, and Waller laces a cut behind point. Well struck.

another successful review! This was again quicker through the air from Permaul, rushing on to Waller as he stepped back and tried to nurdle it to leg. Ball hit pad, sparking a massive appeal, but it was turned down. After a short conference, Bravo asks for a review, and replays show that the ball would've cannoned into middle and leg.
Chibhabha is off the mark straight away, driving through mid off.
nudged to mid on.
turned with the spin into the leg side.
beaten outside off! Quicker through the air, leaving him off the track, and Chibhabha - playing for offspin - holds his bat inside the line.
there's a run! Punched through cover for a single.
sharp spin! Chakabva was thinking about leaving this, but it came in to him and he thrust the bat out at the last moment, chopping it down through gully.
another arm ball rushes past Chakabva's defenses ... This may not last long.
driven back to the bowler.
Chibhabha on the drive again, this time picking out extra cover.
speared in, the ball goes on with the arm from round the wicket and he hurries to keep it out.
yet another dot ball, Chibhabha being tied down here.
Chibhabha looks to work the ball to long on, but the ball spins away from him and the leading edge goes back to the bowler.
finally, the single comes, the ball going down to fine leg. But that does just mean that he'll keep the strike.
tapped back to the bowler.
there's a single, Chibhabha staying deep in his crease to place the ball towards gully.
Turned with the spin into the leg side.
no run to be had there, Chakabva clipping straight to midwicket.
another dot ball, Bravo pulling off a tumbling stop on the leg side.
and Chakabva picks out an infielder on the off side to end the over.
full and straight, clipped off the toes and straight to midwicket.
and now straight to the man on the other side of the wicket, short extra cover stopping a backfoot punch.
flicked with plenty of bottom hand, straight back to the bowler.
past the man at midwicket, and they take a single.
chopped down into the off side.
and another quick single ends the over, Chibhabha threading the ball through the leg side field.
Deonarine comes round the wicket, Chibhabha pushing the ball back to the bowler.
and straight back to the bowler again, Chibhabha struggling to find the single.
Chibhabha aims for midwicket this time, but there's no gap there either.
and back to the bowler again.
this time he tries to thread the ball into the off side, but it's straight to cover point.
And another dot! A maiden for Deonarine, and that over was done and dusted in just 48 seconds!
a single for Chakabva, down to long on.
and Chibhabha follows suit, driven straight down to long on.
oh dear, that is a horrid stroke to get out to. Chakabva was neither forward nor back as he swished the bat across the line. Permaul pushed it through quicker, and the stumps are disturbed.
a nervous looking start from the youngster, but he survives his first delivery in ODIs.
and he's off the mark now, tapping the ball to leg for a single.
surprise, surprise, Chibhabha plays out a dot ball to end the over.
Tino no. 3 drives Narine down to long on for a single.
flicked across the line to midwicket.
a top edge loops down to fine leg for a single.
swept out to deep square leg.
driven at the man at short, straight mid-on, who pops it back to the bowler.
another sweep, this time from Chibhabha. They think about a second run, but wisely decide against it.
full and straight to start, Chibhabha leaning forward to defend.
very full again, Roach attacking the stumps. Driven back to the bowler.
Roach invites the drive with a hint of width outside off, but Chibhabha's shot goes straight to the cover fielder.
heaved across the line to midwicket.
Chibhabha has another big swing at this one, but Roach fields it easily in his follow through.
a touch shorter in length, and Chibhabha looks to nudge it off the hip, but Mutombodzi decides against the run - and rightly so.
scooting on with the arm, Mutombodzi plays a little cluelessly inside the line and is beaten.
Off the body, and the ball flies to slip! Again, Mutombodzi didn't really appear to have much idea what the ball was going to do, and it fairly spat up at him.
well, that's one way to play! Mutombodzi makes room and thrashes the ball up and over cover.
and now he smokes it into the leg side! He looks a lot more confident when he goes on the attack, bending down to sweep the ball over deep square.
Mutombodzi stays deep in his crease to defend, and this time he's able to lay bat on ball.
nudged defensively back to the bowler to end the over.
a big appeal for low, Roach firing this one in full and fast, but it's turned down. Yep, would've gone down leg.
beaten outside off stump! It was the full, wide yorker and young Mutombodzi drove over the top of it.
and again! Mutombodzi bends his knee to get low down on the drive, but the ball is quickly past him.
full and fast, Mutombodzi digging it out to cover point.

he's been tied down, unable to get the ball off the square in this over, and finally the frustration has shown. Mutombodzi taps another full delivery straight towards mid off, but sets off on a somewhat suicidal run ... The throw from the fielder is bang on target, and he's a good eight inches short. They send the decision up to the third umpire just to be sure, and he's well out.
another full delivery to end the over, Chibhabha turning the ball to midwicket.
Bravo starts with a slower ball
dug in very short indeed, the ball ballooning over the ducking batsman.
a very slow delivery cuts In a touch off the track, and Mushangwe chops it down close on the off side.
aimed at the legs, the ball striking the pad and rolling to fine leg.

bowled! No great pace from Bravo, but he's been deadly accurate today and Mushangwe's stumps are rattled as he flicks across the line. The ball may have deviated away from him ever so slightly, but it was nothing major. He just missed it!
on a length outside off, and Jarvis sees fit to raise his hands and leave it alone.
the slower one from Bravo, just 99kph, and Jarvis is too early into his forward defensive push. The ball bounces a little more than he expected, and he's struck on the thigh.
full, slapped to cover.
some aggression from Chibhabha! He spots a Roach slower ball early and scythes through the line, lifting the ball over mid off and away for four.
again Chibhabha backs away, but this time Roach follows him. He nudges a single through square leg to put Jarvis on strike.
hurled down the leg side.
pitched right up, and driven rather well by Jarvis - but straight to point.
a touch wider, and again Jarvis goes on the drive. The ball skews a little finer than he was hoping for, and they run a second as third man sprints round.
pitched in the blockhole, and dug out back down the track.
clipped powerfully off the toes, and a second run is on as he picks the gap at deep midwicket.
Bravo loops down a slower one, giving Chibhabha no pace or width to work with.
the quicker one from Bravo, Chibhabha rolling his wrists over the top of it for a single to midwicket.
Jarvis walks into a slightly awkward drive, the ball trickling to extra cover.
a slow offcutter is tapped softly into the off side.

that's more like it! Jarvis lifts yet another slower ball back over the bowler's head. There's precious little timing in the stroke, but it's nicely straight, landing between the outfielders, so they take a second run.

an uppercut flies in the air down to third man ... where Narine manages to keep it inside the rope, stopping the boundary. But should this count as a dropped catch? He got to it, but was always in risk of tumbling over the boundary. Ultimately, he did well to keep them to just a single.
Jarvis props half forward to push to cover.
bouncer! Pretty quick too, but Jarvis' knees buckle in good time and he ducks underneath it.
another short one! But this is dug in practically at his own feet, and is called wide as it rises high over Jarvis' off stump.
yes indeed! But it's well dug out by the batsman.
Best attacks the stumps once more, but Jarvis keeps it out.
and he ends with a slower ball, which is picked and nudged away for a single.
and now Bravo lets fly with a bumper at the Zimbabwean fast bowler! But again, it's too short and also goes down the leg side.
he follows that up with a slow offcutter, Jarvis nudging the ball into the covers.
full, straight and quicker. Pushed back to the bowler.
Bravo offers width, and Jarvis' drive is stopped at point.
Jarvis goes for an optimistic heave, but it's another slower one from Bravo and he's through the shot before the ball gets to him. It scoots past the outside edge and bounces through to Ramdin.
Jarvis drives with high left elbow, making sure to get bat on ball, and finds something of a gap through mid off.
a slower ball, full and on the stumps, is placed into the gap at midwicket for a single.

a flash, an edge, and a boundary! Best is bowling very quickly now, but this was wide of off stump and Chibhabha had a full go at it. There's no-one in the slips, so the edge flew down to third man for four.
beaten on the inside edge! This curved in through the air as it neared Chibhabha, snaking past his forcing stroke and flying over middle stump.
and now he beats him with the slower ball! Looped down outside off, Chibhabha thrusts the bat out with no great certainty and the ball dribbles past him.
finally, bat on ball brings a single. Best aimed this one at the stumps, but Chibhabha jabbed the bat down in time to find a single to long on.
pushed through outside off, Jarvis leaving it well alone.
So nearly a wicket! Best beat Jarvis for pace with a length delivery, the ball jagging in to him to take the inside edge and bounce just past the stumps.

goodness me, that is shockingly lazy fielding from Powell. Chibhabha slammed a full ball down the ground, getting a good connection, but Powell was at long on and should have stopped it. Instead, he ran right over it, trying to kick the ball back but stepping right over it.
and that'll rub it in! Chibhabha is growing in confidence now, and he picks a slower one, smoking it over wide long on!
Bravo comes round the wicket, and the batsman is able to bunt a low full toss down to long off for a single.
another slower one from Bravo, and I'm not sure Jarvis picked it. He lined up a big shot, but couldn't lay bat on ball.
Another slower one, and this time Jarvis waits to chip it down to long off.
a tip and run single, wide of extra cover, keeps Chibhabha on strike.
speared down the leg side, another run in the extras column.
dug out back down the track, and Best jumps across the pitch to cut it off.
wide of off stump, and Chibhabha chips the ball over mid off ... it plugs in the outfield, but they're easily back for a second run.
quick, and landing on a length. Chibhabha aims a hurried jab into the leg side, and they take a single as the ball rolls to fine leg.

superb reflex catch! Jarvis cleared his front leg and aimed to smite this down the ground, but toe-ended it in the air straight back to Best. It was still fit fairly hard, and Best clung onto it with minimal fuss.
Mpofu is off mark straight away, the ball striking the inner half of the bat and rolling into a gap at midwicket.
punched down the ground, and Chibhabha retains the strike for the final over.
full, and slammed down the ground ... But he can't find the boundary, and they manage just a single.

Mpofu is an all sorts of trouble to this Bravo slower ball, his bat becoming entangled in his pad as he falls across his front leg. There's a big appeal, and it's upheld by Ian Gould, but Mpofu opts to review it, and why not? Actually, that's a good call, as replays show it was missing leg!
dug out to cover, where there's no single to be had.
there's a single! Mpofu bunts the ball down the ground for a single, giving Chibhabha the final two deliveries to work with.
Bravo comes back round the wicket to Chibhabha, who charges out but bottom edges the hoick, Ramdin doing well to stop it. And Mpofu wants the single! A flabbergasted Chibhabha sends him back.
Chamu ends the innings in style! Bravo helped him with a hip high full toss, outside leg, but he connected really well with the heave to leg to end the innings with a six.

inn2.comm: pitched up to the stumps, pushed out to mid off
starts it just outside off stump with the angle and takes it further away from the left-hander with some movement, nice bounce, no need to go after that
much straighter now, back of a length and straightening a bit into Powell, who works it away to deep square leg off the hip
right on the off stump from Jarvis, good length, Sarwan behind it to block
good length, worked off the pads to square leg for a single
tight finish to the over, good length again, just around off stump, Powell defends to covers
starts with a 125 kph length ball but it is towards the pads and Sarwan can nudge it wide of short fine
on to the left-hander's thigh pad this time, from short of a length, rolls away to short fine
steady length ball bounces extra, Sarwan carefully pushes to the off, West Indies in no hurry
there is some width, and Sarwan is very strong square of the wicket on the off side, he places it neatly behind backward point
uh oh, this is not a poor start from Mpofu, now he sends one with the angle comfortably down the leg side
much better, pitches it up on off stump, Sarwan forward to push it back to the bowler, who stops it with a dive
into the pads once more, Zimbabwe need to find some consistency with the lines, Sarwan helps himself to another easy single, though he had to rush to make his ground in the end
this seamed back in off a length, Sarwan rolling his wrists over it to send the ball to short fine leg for a single.
good pace from Jarvis, up at 136kph, and the ball rises off a length as Powell stands tall to guide it to third man. Not a great deal of swing though.
full and straight, turned off the pad. The short fine leg fielder pulls off a sharp stop.
watchful stuff from Sarwan, nudging the ball back to the bowler.
Jarvis has found a bit of fire in his belly, and tests Sarwan with a bouncer ... but it doesn't get up too high, and Sarwan sends a controlled pull out into the deep.
shot! A good over us ruined by a classical stroke from Powell, who leans into a checked drive to send the ball racing to the extra cover boundary.
Mpofu hits a good length outside off, and Sarwan props half forward in defense.
accurately bowled once more, though at no great pace. Mpofu slings it down at 126.4kph and Sarwan comes forward to defend.
a hint of away shape outside off, but it's well covered and played with soft hands too, rolling along the ground to gully.
a little too full, and too straight, so Sarwan is able to lean into a nudge to mid-on.
played with an angled defensive bat, the ball going gully on the bounce.
the slower ball from Mpofu, Powell coming forward to meet it with bat and pad firmly together.
Jarvis attacks the stumps with a length delivery, which Sarwan drives to mid-on.
driven back to the bowler, who palms it to mid-on.
Jarvis bends his back in sending this one down, reaching 134.6kph, but Sarwan is reasonably unrushed as he nudges to midwicket.
Jarvis' line goes wider of off stump, but Sarwan's response is similarly defensive.
this time Sarwan will have a drive, but there's a ring of fielders on the off side and he can't get through it.
defended back down the track, and Jarvis completes a maiden.
nudged off the hip. Not the greatest connection, but he finds room for a single.
cut hard as Mpofu offers width outside off, but Chibhabha dives to stop the shot at point, and neither batsman will commit to the single.
played down with soft hands towards gully, Mpofu sending this one down at 129.2kph.
flicked off the hip, and down to fine leg for a single.
Mpofu is excited as he squares Powell up with one that seams across him, but he doesn't go too hard at the ball, and it's safely negotiated.
Powell flicks across his front pad, but aims his stroke straight at the midwicket fielder.
Jarvis feeds Sarwan a short ball outside off stump, and it's only some committed fielding at third man that saves the boundary.
another bumper, this one straighter and Sarwan pulls to deep square leg.
driven through extra cover, where the fielder dives over it ... but Mawoyo is after it, and hauls the ball in before the rope. They might've run three if they'd pushed a little harder there.
close! Powell taps to mid on, and they set off, but not straight away. The mid on fielder shies at the stumps, and the throw goes wide. It would've been rather touch and go if he'd hit the stumps.
pushed through on a length outside off, Sarwan raising his arms to leave.
an inside edge onto the pads has Jarvis yelping in anticipation, but there's no harm done to the West Indies scorecard.
Powell takes the bottom hand off the bat as he chops a length delivery down to gully, where it bounces past the fielder and they amble through for a single.
short, and rising over off stump. Sarwan watches it past.
free runs for the right-hander. Mpofu shoots one down full on a leg stump line, and all Sarwan has to do is lay bat on it to beat the man at short fine leg.
A much better line, right on off stump, sees Sarwan defending to cover.
Chibhabha has more work to do at backward point. The delivery sat up outside off and Sarwan laced a cut shot, but straight at the fielder, who is almost knocked off his feet but stops the shot.
punched to cover, on the walk, for no run.
express from Jarvis! He shoots this one across Powell's bows at a heady 139.3kph, but it's left alone and can do no harm.
he follows that up with a slower ball bouncer, Powell ducking with ages to spare.
poor line to the left-hander, who just shuffles across to the off stump and nudges off his hip for a couple.
driven with style! Jarvis floated up a half volley, and Powell sent the ball careening to the cover boundary with a full flow of the bat.

edged! It was the slow offcutter from Jarvis, and it took a thick edge as it deviated away from Powell's angled bat ... but it bounces awkwardly about a foot in front of Taylor, and he can't cut it off.
driven powerfully, but straight at the short extra cover fielder, who is very close in and pulls off a sharp stop. Sibanda, it is.
on a length, and rising off it so dull the power of Sarwan's attempted drive.
the slower ball this time, and Sarwan comes forward to defend.
Sarwan lines up a cut as he spots a short ball outside off, but he doesn't quite have the width to work with, and chops the ball straight down.
Mpofu hits a shortish length outside off, but Sarwan is quite happy to see the delivery off defensively.
oh dear, a slower ball goes horribly wrong and flies way down the leg side.
that's better from Mpofu, who is on the mark to draw more defense from Sarwan.
and another defensive push ends the over.
he's on target straight away, drawing Powell forward in defense.
appreciable spin back in to the left-hander, who does well to get forward and smother it.
swept hard to leg, but there's cover out in the deep so it's just a single.
pushed down to long on with plenty of bottom hand.
speared down flat and fast on off stump, the ball rushing straight on as Powell defends to point.
drilled down the ground for a single, long off cleaning up.
driven hard down to long on.
Sarwan has a look, pushing the ball back to the bowler.

he's struck! A classic legspinner's dismissal opens Mutombodzi's international account. He gave the ball some loop, and it dipped and drifted in as it reached Sarwan. The batsman pushed forward at it, but the ball spun across him, took the leading edge, and was gleefully snapped up by the bowler!
Bravo is off the mark straight away with a strong drive that necessitates a diving stop from the mid-off fielder.
looped down just outside off, Powell pokes it away defensively.
turned with the spin to midwicket.
Bravo is well forward to smother any hint of spin in defense.
defended with an angled bat towards point.
nudged softly back to the bowler, Mushangwe maintaining great control.
driven to extra cover, where Sibanda dives to stop it cleanly and get the ball back to the bowler in one motion.
more watchful defense from Bravo. This is turning into really tight over.
pushed through quicker, possibly the googly, but Bravo is firm in defense.
eased down to long on.
clipped off the toes, but straight to short fine leg.
beaten outside off! Bravo expected turn but this one went straight on to beat his outside edge. To his credit, he held the bat inside the line and didn't poke at it.
just a little too wide outside off, and Bravo steps back to punch through cover.
fuller, and with more flight. Bravo is forward in defense.
Bounce for Mutombodzi! Bravo takes his bottom hand off the bat as this one spits at him.
swept out to deep square, where there is a man out.
chopped down to backward point.
Bravo taps softly to cover point and searches for a single, but there's none to be had.
flicked through midwicket, where a slight fumble allows a single.
swept out to deep square once again, Powell rotating the strike well with this shot.
and firm defense ends the over.
dropped with soft hands into the gap, the call for a single comes quickly and firmly, and they sprint through.
Bravo leans into a drive, but pings the cover fielder.
played with the spin, just to the left of the short fine leg fielder so a single is on.
Powell stays deep in his crease, but his nudge goes straight to midwicket.
another soft tap to cover point, this time quick fielding stops the single.
clipped firmly to leg with the spin, but midwicket dives to stop it.
punched back to the bowler.
Bravo steps back and laces the ball square, but again he finds the fielder.
eased down to long on, an ambled single.
Powell misses the sweep this time! The ball dipped under his bat as he played the shot, Taylor stopping the ball.
where's the slip? Powell lunges into a drive as Mushangwe lands one well wide of him, but it flies off the edge and down to third man.
and a drive down the ground brings a single to end the over.
tapped square of the wicket, and they push for a quick single. There's a shy, and the stumps are broken! How close is this? The umpires ask for a television replay, but he's easily home.
too short, too wide, and Bravo thrashes the cut away. The first really bad ball Mutombodzi's bowled in an otherwise impressive spell.
looped up, straighter, and it's played back to the bowler.
crunched away through the off side, and they're back or the second.
nicely bowled, up to the bat and Bravo can't get it away.
nudged away for a single, and Bravo keeps the strike. He's not got going so far, but Powell is flowing well at the other end.
now Mushangwe errs in line! Much too short, and wide too. Bravo's cut can't be stopped, and that'll relieve some pressure.
a better line, and bowled with some real flight too. Nudged back to the bowler.
that's a good line! Mushangwe rushes one past Bravo's outside edge.
eased down the ground for a single.
tapped back to the bowler, no run there.
and another defensive push takes us to the drinks interval.
nudged with the spin off the pad wide of short fine
goes for a big sweep, misses, as ball turns down leg
nice flight, dips on him fullish, pushed back to the bowler
good length ball spins into the pads and is worked square
tossed up delivery turned softly to leg, eludes a running  bowler, midwicket prevents the run
eases a full delivery to the bowler
straightens on middle, Bravo has bat in front of pad to defend
he's swept well, but has been finding deep square, this time he powerfully hits this full one through square leg to beat the man in the deep, who was backward of square
punched to extra cover
tossed up outside off stump and hits him on the pad on the forward push
dabs it down to short third man
he lunges at another sweep, but the ball pops up off pad
looked to the the googly, tossed in from round the stumps and straightens on off stump, Powell manages to get bat down to keep it out
pitches leg stump and turns down the leg side

chance of a run out at the striker's end, they go for a quick single after Bravo pushes towards square leg, midwicket runs in and lobs the ball to the keeper, who breaks the stumps with the batsman just short of his ground, the ball popped out of his gloves after he takes the bails off, but surprisingly, there is not much of an appeal from Zimbabwe
pushed down the track
Powell's gone this time alright, steps out, tries to loft it down the ground but picks out long on, third time this series he's given away a start
widish one cut away
reaches forward to a dipping low full toss and drives to long off
defends a flighted delivery outside off stump
shuffles across and whips a length ball with the spin to deep midwicket
goes forward and runs a fullish one to point
spins in sharply from outside off and he awkwardly stabs it away
goes reaching after a widish one outside off and pushes to cover
goes back and works with the turn through square leg
goes across with the front foot and nudges to square leg
whips a full and flighted one through midwicket for a couple
goes across him with the angle, he gets forward and runs it past short third man
another one skids across and is steered to point
full and tossed up, whipped down to long on
not much flight to start, and it's turned to midwicket.
pushed to leg once more, pinging the field.
shot! Deonarine skips out to get to the pitch and lofts the ball to wide long off. The shot was well hit and perfectly placed too.
and he follows that up with a single, good batting, easing the ball into the off side.
driven through extra cover, Waller coming round the wicket and pitching the ball right up to invite the drive.
Deonarine threads the ball through cover with a wrists drive, the cover sweeper cleaning up.
whipped down to long on with a flourish.
pushed through flatter by Mutombodzi. Bravo tries to work it off the pad but the ball doesn't get off the square.
very full on off stump, and tapped defensively to cover point.
Bravo finds a single into the leg side.
punched towards mid on, Mutombodzi charges across but midwicket gets to it first.
and another wrists flick brings another single. Deonarine sometimes struggles to rotate the strike early on, but he's done alright so far.
landing full on off stump, and Deonarine comes forward to drive to long off.
Bravo laces a drive past a diving cover fielder, but the cover sweeper sprints round to cut it off.
This time he finds the gap! The ball and the shot were almost identical, but Bravo placed this one a little better to beat the cover sweeper.
defended to cover, they look for a single but there's none to be had.
the quicker one from Masakadza, at 112.7kph, and it's driven to long off.
and Deonarine follows suit, driving down the ground.
Turned with the spin into the leg side.
was this a wrong 'un? It went on with the arm as Bravo leaned forward to defend.
driven hard to extra cover, where a diving Sibanda takes the sting out of the shot but can't stop the single.
eased back down the track.
this time he places it to Mutombodzi's left, and the single is taken.
Looped up, and defended back to the bowler to end another good over from the young spinner.
good length from Masakadza, hitting the top of off, but Deonarine is right to it as he defends.
a little wider of off, and Deonarine places it to cover.
wider still, and Bravo stays deep in the crease to cut hard out to the cover sweeper.
slapped square of the wicket, where Chibhabha dives to stop it cleanly.
a quick single, and sharper fielding might've resulted in a run out! Deonarine inside edged into the leg side, and they set off, but that throw wasn't on target.
Zimbabwe's fielding has been much better today, and once again it's Chibhabha at cover point who pulls off a diving stop. He can't quite stop the single, howeve.
turned with the spin, the ball flighted right up to the bat, but hit straight to midwicket.
this time Bravo aims squarer, but the square leg fielder swoops to stop the single
looped up a little too far, and Bravo punts a low full toss down to long on.
quicker through the air, and Deonarine nurdles to leg to no great effect.
an almost identical ball and shot combo, Mutombodzi spearing one at the pads and Deonarine defending to leg.
and Deonarine drives to mid off, who is up, to end a fine first international spell from Tino Mutombodzi.
perhaps a touch short of a good length outside off, but Bravo is content to play the ball softly to gully as there wasn't much width on offer.
driven, on the up, to extra cover.
now there is some width, but it's cut off the front foot straight to Waller at backward point.
Masakadza is doing a good job of stringing together dot balls here, as Bravo comes forward once again to punch to cover.
just a touch too full, and Bravo drives down to long off.ld

gone! Masakadza has struck for Zimbabwe, and it's Mutombodzi at midwicket who takes the catch! It was an innocuous delivery, floated up on middle stump, but Deonarine whipped it in the air and straight to the fielder.
he comes round the wicket to Bravo, who nudges to leg with the spin.

Pollard is run out without facing a ball! Bravo flicked the ball to fine leg, and as they turned it appeared the second run might be on ... but Bravo hesitated, and then sent Pollard back. The throw was on target, Taylor had the bails off in a flash, and Zimbabwe have a chance now!
the elder Bravo comes forward to poke the ball to point.
Nicely accurate from Mushangwe, and Bravo defends.
spinning away on off stump, and tapped to cover.
an emphatic way to get off the mark! Bravo sends a scorching drive through cover as Mushangwe overpitches outside off.
width offered outside off, and Darren drives on the up through the gap at cover.
that's a good looking shot for just two runs, Bravo driving handsomely through extra over. The sweeper sprints round to stop the third.
on a length, and straight. Bravo defends.
a poor ball is flung down the leg side, an irate Taylor can't stop it, and they take a single to add to the wide.
cut hard out to the cover sweeper.
Masakadza plugs away on off stump, Bravo happy to defend the good deliveries.
shot! That's the problem with a bowler of Masakadza's pace. He errs in line, slipping towards leg stump, and Bravo simply swings his arms through the line to lift the ball over wide long on.
a question is asked as the ball spins in and possibly hits pad first, but the umpire isn't interested.
flighted on off stump, Darren Bravo defends.
chipped down the ground, the ball landing well in front of the long on fielder.
Dwayne Bravo skips down the track, but Mushangwe spots him coming and adjusts his length to draw hurried defense from the West Indies captain.
flight and guile to end the over, Mushangwe testing Bravo's defense with one that dips, grips and spins across him.
full, wide and going further with the angle across the left hander, who skews a drive down to third man.
pitched right up to the bat, Bravo driving down to long on.
the slower one kicks off a length, but Bravo gets across and nudges it off the hip to fine leg.
slapped out to deep cover with typical flourish, Jarvis is annoyed as some tardy fielding allows a second run.
another slower one, this one much slower at just 102.2kph, and Dwayne Bravo punches off the back foot to cover.
Darren Bravo gets onto the front foot to place the ball through extra cover for a single.
rising off a length, and Bravo nudges off the hip for a single.
very full, and perhaps just tailing in to the right-hander a touch. Bravo clips off the toes out to square leg. Taylor tells the fielder there, Mawoyo, to send the ball back in on the bounce.
a slower offcutter is played into the leg side.
Dwayne Bravo comes forward to drive to long on.
superb fielding in the covers saves four runs. It was a full toss from Mpofu, and Bravo gave it an almighty thump, but the fielder there put himself in the way of the ball.
short outside off, and cut through cover point.
full outside off stump, Darren Bravo stepping to the pitch and driving out to the cover sweeper.
very full. Bravo clips off the toes but finds the midwicket fielder.
A slower bouncer is pulled out behind square on the leg side, and the midwicket fielder has some work to do in getting round to it.
eased down to long on, the singles coming easily - but no boundaries as yet.
driven powerfully through extra cover, but there's a sweeper out there.
a low full toss is slapped off the middle and out to wide long on, where Masakadza gets round to cut it off.
Bravo goes to fifty in typical style! He's scored most of his runs through the off side, and places this shot to perfection to bring up what should be a matchwinning fifty.
again he aims for the cover boundary, but this time there's a fielder in the way inside the circle.
drilled down to long off.
a slower ball, not quite picked as the bottom hand comes off the bat, but he places it well enough to find a single through mid off.
full, and Bravo closes the face on the drive to place the ball through mid off.
full and straight, yet another slower one, and Dwayne Bravo works it off the pad for a single.
the ball jags in and take the inside edge, rolling to square leg. Dwayne Bravo isn't sure where the ball has gone, but his brother calls him through for an easy single.
a shovelled drive to a 100kph slower ball rolls through cover, just the one.

got him! Zimbabwe have found a late wicket, and Jarvis has his first in the series! It was another very slow offcutter, and Dwayne Bravo tried to get underneath it and blast it over midwicket. He got rather too far underneath it, however, and Masakadza held onto a simple catch at wide long on.
Darren Bravo picks up exactly where he left off, leaning forward to thump the ball through extra cover.
both Jarvis and Taylor have their hands in the air as Ramdin plays right across his pad to work the ball to midwicket.
full, and dug out into the leg side. Mid on sprints in to stop the single.
Mushangwe comes round the wicket, and Bravo defends.
quicker through the air, hurrying Bravo's defense.
crunched to cover, where it's stopped but not well enough to cut off the single.
edged past the diving slip fielder! A great piece of legspin bowling, drawing him forward and taking a thick edge which flew wide of the slip fielder.
Ramdin follows the loose shot up with more watchful defense.
Looped up enticingly, Ramdin tapping to cover.
great timing! One can see what Jarvis was trying to do, aiming for the yorker outside off, but it slipped out as a low full toss and Bravo just caressed it to the point boundary.
full once more, and pushed through the gap at extra cover for one.
again Ramdin whips right across his pad to a full, straight one to excite Taylor! He gets bat on ball, but finds midwicket.
a slower ball, outside off, is run down to third man.
on a length, but outside off and Bravo chops down on the ball to pick up a single to third man.
pinpoint yorker! Jarvis is searching for Ramdin's pads, and this was a really good delivery - but the batsman is equal to it and digs the ball out to leg.
landing wide of off, and Bravo punches off the back foot to cover point.
very full, right on middle, and punched down the ground. From the look of things, Zimbabwe reckon they can get Ramdin lbw.
placed through the covers for a single.
wide of off, and Ramdin punches out to the cover sweeper.

some committed fielding from Mawoyo out on the cover boundary saves two runs! Bravo was on the cut once more, and hit this one really well. It looked like four, but Mawoyo sprinted round and put in a desperate dive to haul it back.
good ball to finish, a slow offcutter takes the outer half of the bat and rolls to gully.
the bouncer strikes Ramdin on the chest! He clearly wasn't expecting the short one, and fended at it quite awkwardly.
now the slower bouncer, and it's pulled in the air towards deep square leg ... but falls short of the fielder!
short of a good length, and outside off. For the umpteenth time today, Bravo cuts out to deep point.

well hit by Ramdin, who comes forward to drive. Both Waller and Mawoyo set off after the ball, Waller quickly overtaking his teammate and sliding to keep the ball inside the boundary. It's a tag team fielding effort, Mawoyo scooping the ball up and hurling it back in.
nudged off the hip, and Umpire Gould wants another look as the shy from the fielder hits the stumps ... but he's easily home.
Jarvis aims for Ramdin's pads one last time, getting the ball to tail in at the last moment, but it's kept out.
flicked off the toes to short fine leg.
the angle takes the ball towards Ramdin's leg stump, and he helps it on its way to pick up a single and take West Indies target for a series whitewash down to just 20.
a much slower one, under 100kph, is eased down to long off for an ambled single.
Ramdin finds the middle of the bat with a leg glance, the fine leg fielder running round as they rush back for the second.
Masakadza offers width outside off, and Ramdin cuts out to deep point.
driven to extra cover, where Bravo picks out a fielder.
Mpofu begins with a bouncer, at just over 128kph, which actually hurries Ramdin a touch as he fends to leg. The ball bounces through to Taylor.
whipped off the pads for a single.
another short one, and Bravo bottom-edges the pull straight into the ground at his feet.

Mpofu is going to end up on the losing side, but he may well leave the batsmen with a few bruises too. This is his quickest ball of the tour, at 136.4kph, and Bravo takes his eyes off it as it spits up at him. The ball strikes the front of the helmet and loops over Taylor.
another short one, and again it's quite quick at 134.3kph. Nudged off the armpit for one.
hurled down the leg side. I think he was aiming for another bouncer there.
placed into the gap at square leg.
full and straight, tapped back to the bowler.
Ramdin comes forward to drive through extra cover.
hacked down to long off for one more.
a slower ball, an offcutter, lands very short and Ramdin puts the long hop away with a hoick over deep midwicket for four.
a late cut rolls straight to Mpofu at short third man.
nicely straight from Chibhabha, and Ramdin stays deep in his crease to play the ball back to him.

the scores are leveled as Bravo taps the ball down towards point and they set off. The point fielder runs in with Bravo not really rushing to make his ground at the non-striker's end, and a direct hit would've had him!
and there's the game, Ramdin swivels into a pull to seal the result with a pull down to the fine leg boundary.
